intro: Bourreria moratiana, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
